metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6096 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the get_history function in history.cgi in Nagios Core before 3.4.4, and Icinga 1.6.x before 1.6.2, 1.7.x before 1.7.4, and 1.8.x before 1.8.4, might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long (1) host_name variable (host parameter) or (2) svc_description variable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6096` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

icinga - 1.7.1-5
icinga-cgi - 1.7.1-5
icinga-cgi-bin - 1.7.1-5
icinga-common - 1.7.1-5
icinga-core - 1.7.1-5
icinga-idoutils - 1.7.1-5
No subscription required

nagios3 - 3.4.1-3
nagios3-cgi - 3.4.1-3
nagios3-common - 3.4.1-3
nagios3-core - 3.4.1-3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> debian bug says nagios patch is possibly incomplete downgrading to "negligible" because of FORTIFY_SOURCE

criterions.comment: icinga package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.1-5').
nagios3 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.1-3').
